channel.title: BBC Sport - Sport
channel.description: The latest stories from the Sport section of the BBC Sport web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Burnley 1-3 Chelsea
item.description: Diego Costa scores on his Chelsea debut as the Premier League title favourites beat newly-promoted Burnley 3-1 at Turf Moor.

item.title: England call up Hales for ODI series
Verstappen, 16, handed Formula 1 drive
BBC's James Alexander Gordon dies
item.description: James Alexander Gordon, one of the most recognisable voices in British broadcasting, dies at the age of 78.

item.title: Nadal pulls out of US Open with injury
'Back to work' for World Cup winners
Palace fined after Cardiff line-up claim
item.description: Crystal Palace have been fined by the Premier League for their involvement in last season's so-called 'spygate' incident with Cardiff City.

item.title: Lelliott and Willmott win bronzes
item.description: Britain's Jay Lelliott and Aimee Willmott win bronze medals on day one of the European Swimming Championships in Berlin.

item.title: Rangers 8-1 Clyde
item.description: Kris Boyd scores a hat-trick as Rangers cruise past League Two Clyde to reach the Petrofac Training Cup third round.

item.title: Weir out of European Championships
item.description: British wheelchair racer David Weir pulls out of this week's IPC Athletics European Championships with tendonitis in an arm.

item.title: We want to fight with best - Wenger
item.description: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger says that the prestige of the Champions League is more important than its financial riches.

item.title: Brook could face Mayweather - Hearn
item.description: New IBF welterweight champion Kell Brook could fight Floyd Mayweather next year, according to promoter Eddie Hearn

item.title: Legia lose bid to overturn Uefa ruling
item.description: The Court of Arbitration for Sport rejects Legia Warsaw's bid to be provisionally reinstated in the Champions League.

item.title: Tiernan-Locke alcohol excuse rejected
item.description: Britain's Jonathan Tiernan-Locke has a two-year doping ban upheld after his "binge drinking" claims are rejected.

item.title: Lancs beat Durham in four-day thriller
item.description: Lancashire hold their nerve to beat Durham by one wicket with just two balls left in a thrilling finish at Old Trafford.

item.title: Australia fitness a worry - O'Brien
item.description: Aidan O'Brien raises concerns over the fitness of double Derby winner Australia before the Juddmonte International at York.

item.title: Yorkshire beat Sussex to stay top
item.description: Yorkshire beat Sussex by nine wickets at Scarborough to stay top of the Championship table despite 113 by Luke Wright.

item.title: Olsson banned for referee incident
item.description: Norwich City defender Martin Olsson is banned for a further three games for putting his hand on referee Simon Cooper.

item.title: Wales set for Ireland RWC warm-ups
item.description: Wales and Ireland are set to meet in warm-up matches in Cardiff and Dublin next year before the 2015 World Cup in England.

item.title: Anderson promises bowling aggression
item.description: James Anderson says he will not curb his aggression as he closes in on Sir Ian Botham's Test wicket record for England.

item.title: Froome leads Team Sky in Vuelta
item.description: Britain's Chris Froome is back from injury to lead Team Sky in the Vuelta a Espana as Mark Cavendish is omitted.

item.title: Dijkstra wins Youth Olympics gold
item.description: Triathlete Ben Dijkstra takes Great Britain's first gold medal at the Youth Olympics despite New Zealand appeal.

item.title: VIDEO: Mourinho praises 'fantastic' Chelsea
item.description: Manager Jose Mourinho says Chelsea have "fantastic mental stability" after recovering to beat newly-promoted Burnley 3-1.

item.title: VIDEO: Suarez will change - Barca president
item.description: Barcelona president Josep Maria Bartomeu says the club will help new signing Luis Suarez who "will change the way he acts".

item.title: VIDEO: What were the best Euro moments?
item.description: BBC Sport's athletics pundits share their favourite moments from the European Athletics Championships in Zurich.

item.title: AUDIO: Robshaw hails Women's World Cup win
item.description: Chris Robshaw believes England's triumph at the Women's Rugby World Cup will inspire a generation of women to play the game.

item.title: VIDEO: Cook salutes 'almost perfect' England
item.description: England captain Alastair Cook says his side have played "almost the perfect games" in the last two Tests after completing a 3-1 series victory over India.

item.title: VIDEO: 'Strong' defence pleases Pellegrini
item.description: Manchester City manager Manuel Pellegrini says his team's strength in defence was the best aspect of their 2-0 win away at Newcastle to open their Premier League title defence.

item.title: VIDEO: Farah wins 5000m & record fifth gold
item.description: Mo Farah wins gold in the 5000m at the European Athletics Championships in Zurich, making him the most successful individual athlete in the history of the competition.

item.title: VIDEO: Rutherford imperious in long jump gold
item.description: Olympic long jump champion Greg Rutherford adds another title to his collection after comfortably winning gold at the European Athletics Championships in Zurich.

item.title: VIDEO: Is Cooly the best mascot ever?
item.description: Meet Cooly, the mascot at the European Athletics Championships who has been delighting the crowds with his antics, including pole vaulting and hurdling.

item.title: VIDEO: Burnley will learn from defeat - Dyche
item.description: Manager Sean Dyche believes his Burnley side will learn from their 3-1 Premier League defeat to Chelsea at Turf Moor.

item.title: VIDEO: The wisdom of James Alexander Gordon
item.description: James Alexander Gordon reveals what it is like being the distinct voice of BBC Radio 5 live's classified football results at the start of Sports Report.

item.title: VIDEO: Biggest crashes of the season so far
item.description: BBC Sport takes a look back at some of the biggest and most spectacular crashes of the 2014 Formula 1 season so far.

item.title: VIDEO: GB win first gold in photo finish
item.description: Triathlete Ben Dijkstra wins GB's first gold medal at the Youth Olympics in Nanjing, China, after beating Daniel Hoy of New Zealand in a photo finish.

item.title: VIDEO: Warren's 'outside' Ryder Cup chance
item.description: BBC Scotland's Kenny Crawford speaks to Marc Warren, who hopes to secure a wildcard for the Ryder Cup at Gleneagles.

item.title: VIDEO: England women on 'dream' World Cup win
item.description: England players react to winning the Women's Rugby World Cup following their 21-9 victory over Canada in the final in Paris.

item.title: VIDEO: Boos and falls in controversial 1500m
item.description: Mahiedine Mekhissi-Benabbad of France is booed by the Zurich crowd as he celebrates in the home straight in winning the 1500m at the European Athletics Championships.

item.title: VIDEO: Jackson's showdown with Cooly the cow
item.description: BBC pundit and former hurdler Colin Jackson takes on the European Athletics Championships' mascot Cooly the Cow in Zurich.

item.title: VIDEO: Highlights - Celtic 6-1 Dundee Utd
item.description: Celtic hit six in their first home Scottish Premiership match of the season against Dundee United (UK Users only).

item.title: VIDEO: MOTD3: Can full-backs still defend?
item.description: Mark Chapman is joined by Danny Murphy and Philip Neville to discuss three key talking points from the opening weekend.

item.title: VIDEO: Bolt on Man Utd's 'defensive problems'
item.description: Manchester United fan Usain Bolt feels his side had "defensive problems" in what he describes as "bad start to the season".

item.title: VIDEO: 'Man Utd need to spend £200m'
item.description: BBC Sport's Match of the Day experts give their thoughts on Manchester United after their 2-1 defeat by Swansea.

item.title: VIDEO: Ramsey reveals rugby union dream
item.description: Wales and Arsenal midfielder Aaron Ramsey lifts the lid on some of his favourite things when he talks to BBC Sport Wales TV.

item.title: VIDEO: Hardaker scores stunning solo try
item.description: Zak Hardaker's excellent individual run gives Leeds a 16-point half-time lead over relegated London Broncos

item.title: VIDEO: Highlights - Hearts 2-1 Hibernian
item.description: Hearts get the better of city rivals Hibernian in the first Edinburgh derby of the season (UK users only).

item.title: VIDEO: Liverpool had desire 'in abundance'
item.description: Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers praises his side's will to win after they overcame Southampton 2-1, and believes the Reds will improve as the season goes on.

item.title: VIDEO: Defeat is rough justice - Pardew
item.description: Newcastle United manager Alan Pardew believes his side's 2-0 defeat by Manchester City is "rough justice" for the club.

item.title: VIDEO: Pulis saga needs explaining - Millen
item.description: Crystal Palace caretaker manager Keith Millen says the players "need an explanation" over Tony Pulis's departure from the club, after they narrowly lose 2-1 against Arsenal on the opening day of the season.

item.title: 'Man Utd miles off Champions League'
item.description: Wins for Manchester City, Liverpool and Arsenal and defeat for Manchester United - BBC's pundits on the first weekend.

item.title: Resurgent England look a team again
item.description: England captain Alastair Cook must be very satisfied with this summer’s extraordinary turnaround, says Jonathan Agnew.

item.title: Six glorious days for Great Britain
item.description: Great Britain made history at the European Championships and their athletes can still improve, writes Tom Fordyce.

item.title: Liverpool show there is life without Suarez
item.description: Tougher opponents await, but there were signs of a more ruthless Liverpool against Southampton in the post-Luis Suarez era.

item.title: Tedium and thunderclaps at Tynecastle
item.description: The first Edinburgh league derby outside the top flight was a mix of the sublime and the ridiculous, argues Tom English.

item.title: Garth Crooks's team of the week
item.description: Which goalscorer's uncle texted Garth Crooks during the game? Find out in his first team of the week of 2014-15.

item.title: What's on BBC Sport this week
item.description: Your guide to sporting events on the BBC, including the Belgian GP, Champions League football and the Challenge Cup final.

item.title: Jelly babies help win football match
item.description: How and why did Lincoln City use jelly babies to beat league leaders Barnet?

item.title: Transfer latest - August 2014
item.description: Track all the latest football signings day by day throughout the close season.

item.title: How to follow the new season on the BBC
item.description: The BBC will provide extensive coverage of the Premier League across TV, radio and online.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - August 2014
item.description: Track managerial ins and outs in the top five leagues in England and Scottish Premiership.

item.title: GB top medal table with 12 golds
item.description: Mo Farah, Greg Rutherford and the relay teams help Britain to a record 12 gold medals at the European Championships.

item.title: Brook wants to set up Khan fight
item.description: Kell Brook has targeted a fight against Amir Khan after becoming the IBF welterweight champion by beating Shawn Porter.

item.title: Hales sees Notts to win at Northants
item.description: Alex Hales scores his third Championship century of the season as Nottinghamshire beat Northants by five wickets.

item.title: UCI boss 'positive' for women's racing
item.description: Ironman champion Chrissie Wellington praises cycling boss Brian Cookson for helping to develop women's racing.

item.title: Rickham & Birrell chase sixth title
item.description: Alexandra Rickham and Niki Birrell are chasing their sixth consecutive parasailing world title in Canada.

item.title: Brandao headbutt breaks Motta's nose
item.description: Paris St-Germain's Thiago Motta suffers a broken nose after Bastia striker Brandao headbutts him, his club confirm.

item.title: Ferrari boss dismisses exit rumours
item.description: Fernando Alonso and Kimi Raikkonen will not leave Ferrari at the end of 2014, according to team president Luca Di Montezemolo.

item.title: Warren's 'outside' Ryder Cup chance
item.description: Scotland's Marc Warren hopes the door for being a wildcard pick for next month's Ryder Cup at Gleneagles remains ajar.

item.title: Eighth horse positive for morphine
item.description: An eighth horse has tested positive for morphine as an investigation continues into possible contaminated feed.

item.title: Youth Olympics implement Ebola ban
item.description: Youth Olympic Games athletes from areas of Africa affected by the Ebola virus will not be allowed to compete in some events.

item.title: London Broncos 40-36 Leeds Rhinos
item.description: London Broncos win their first Super League match of the season at the 24th attempt, as Leeds suffer a shock defeat.

item.title: England World Cup win 'surreal'
item.description: Head coach Gary Street says it is a "bit like a dream" as England win their first World Cup in 20 years.

item.title: Trump wins Australian Open final
item.description: World number six Judd Trump beats home favourite Neil Robertson 9-5 in the final of the Australian Goldfields Open.

item.title: Team GB 'spurred on by Glasgow 2014'
item.description: Commonwealth champion Jazz Carlin believes Glasgow 2014 success will boost Team GB's confidence at the European Championships.

item.title: Federer wins Cincinnati Masters
item.description: World number three Roger Federer beats David Ferrer for a 16th successive time to win a sixth Cincinnati title.

item.title: Double gold winner in two-year ban
item.description: Olympic cross-country skiing champion Evi Sachenbacher-Stehle is banned for two years after a failed drugs test at Sochi 2014.

item.title: Mourinho selects Courtois over Cech
item.description: Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho has confirmed Thibaut Courtois as his new number one goalkeeper.

item.title: Celtic chase Rubin's Wakaso on loan
item.description: Ghana winger Mubarak Wakaso is wanted by Celtic on loan from Rubin Kazan ahead of a Champions League qualifier.

item.title: Cardiff defender joins St Etienne
item.description: Cardiff City's French defender Kevin Theophile-Catherine has joined St Etienne on a season-long loan.

item.title: VIDEO: Irish League Show - Programme 2
item.description: Joel Taggart and Chris Morgan review the second weekend of Irish Premiership fixtures.
